From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 10/23/2024 10:00 PM
To: pgoyette@nixonpeabody.com<mailto:pgoyette@nixonpeabody.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #420336 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FRWuS:ref ]

Hey Paul,

To install with the add-ons leave them all selected and the file name should look like this: EPPClientSetup.6.2.3.1010_x86_64_[a=192.168.0.0].msi
The attributes are missing which means that they will be installed. Also in the msiexec, remove the outlook_ext part.

Without add-ons unselect the add-ons you do not want and it should look like this: EPPClientSetup.6.2.3.1010_x86_64_[a=192.168.0.0,o=0,n=0].msi
The attributes o=0 and n=0 mean they are not installed.

Let me know how it goes.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Paul Goyette

Ticket Number: 00420336
Ticket Subject: Outlook Add-in Installation
Ticket Details: Hello, how can I find out whether the Outlook add-in is installed? If I look in my Outlook client--Manage Add-ins or Manage COM Add-ins, I cannot see any EPP add-in. Is there someplace else I can look (like the Windows registry)?

Thank you!

Eduard Nut
